column4: hi guys, I have bought a Dell 1564 with i3 and I installed Ubuntu 9.04 and I have shitty graphics :( how to solve that please?
I tried Lucid beta and the graphics problem is solved, but it's highly unstable :(
dude the graphic card is Intel which is integrated in the CPU
this is a common problem among people :)
What should I say... Upgrade to 9.10 or wait for the 10.04 These distributions support kms (kernel mode settings) for your card.
I tried 9.10 but it doesn't work either!
tried Lucid and it solves the problem, but it's NOT stable at all :(
wait for lucid. It's probably the best.
I need to use my computer!!! :(
Sorry... I don't know what you mean by shitty graphics. if you have to, modify your /etc/xorg.conf of your 9.04 install and use the basic vesa driver.
some people said that they modified xorg.conf and change vesa to Intel
but I couldn't find the "vesa" part in that file
yeah... In 9.04 /etc/xorg.conf is still present but 'empty'... There should be some examples in the forums, dealing that problem.
